title: Rain (Beatles song)
summary: "Rain" is a song by the English rock band the Beatles, released on 30 May 1966 as the B-side of their "Paperback Writer" single. Both songs were recorded during the sessions for Revolver, although neither appear on that album. "Rain" was written by John Lennon and credited to the Lennonâ€“McCartney partnership. He described its meaning as "about people moaning about the weather all the time".[3]
